Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "fix(history-mode): correcting indentation in web.config example" (#1948) at vuejs/vue-router
Opened issue "Missing param for named route: Expected "x" to be defined" (#1947) at vuejs/vue-router
Closed issue "router-link dynamic path in a v-for loop generates the same path" (#1946) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version 3.0.1 ### Reproduction link [https://jsfiddle.net/my55vpqr/23/](https://jsfiddle.net/my55vpqr/23/) ### Steps to reproduce Template: ```html
The result will always be 'foo'.
  • {{item.id}}. {{ item.param }}
``` JS: ```javascript const whatever = { props: ['id'], template: '
{{id}}
' } const router = new VueRouter({ routes: [ { path: '/preview/:id', name: 'preview', component: whatever, props: true } ] }) new Vue({ el: '#root', router, data: { items: [ { id: 1, param: 'foo' }, { id: 2, param: 'bar' }, { id: 3, param: 'what'} ] } }) ``` ### What is expected? The three links in the loop should be: '/preview/foo' '/preview/bar' '/preview/what' ### What is actually happening? They actually are: '/preview/foo' '/preview/foo' '/preview/foo'

### Version 3.0.1 ### Reproduction link [https://jsfiddle.net/my55vpqr/23/](https://jsfiddle.net/my55vpqr/23/) ### Steps to reproduce Template: ```html
  • {{item.id}}. {{ item.param }}
``` JS: ```javascript const whatever = { props: ['id'], template: '
{{id}}
' } const router = new VueRouter({ routes: [ { path: '/preview/:id', name: 'preview', component: whatever, props: true } ] }) new Vue({ el: '#root', router, data: { items: [ { id: 1, param: 'foo' }, { id: 2, param: 'bar' }, { id: 3, param: 'what'} ] } }) ``` ### What is expected? The three links in the loop should be: '/preview/foo' '/preview/bar' '/preview/what' ### What is actually happening? They actually are: '/preview/foo' '/preview/foo' '/preview/foo'

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "vue-router doesn't work on IOS 10.3.2 (14F89) but works on IOS 11.2 (15C114)" (#1933) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/fLswsLzh/](https://jsfiddle.net/fLswsLzh/)

### Steps to reproduce
1.- Open fiddle
2.- The router links are not available for IOS 10 (ipad mini 4 and ipad pro devices) either on Safari or Chrome browsers but they are available and work as expected on IOS 11 (ipad mini 4)


### What is expected?
You should be able to access the router links

### What is actually happening?
Router links are not available for IOS 10 (Ipad Mini 4 and Ipad Pro) but they are available on IOS 11 as expected.

---
Behavior can easily reproduce on both devices using Safari and Chrome browsers.

Do you have this bug confirmed? and, which version is preferred to use on IOS 10 then?
